page.title: 08Housing in New Mills
page.content: Most of the people in New Mills live mainly in stone built and terraced houses. Only the council houses are rented and the other houses are owned by the people who live in them. There are no tower blocks of flats. The first council houses were erected on the High Hill Road area in 1919-20 (High Hill Estate). The Bakehurst Estate was started in 1927. There has been some new council houses like Highfield Estate, Diglands Estate, including extensions to the Bakehurst Estate. 725 council houses have been erected by 1973, some of which have subsequently been sold. There are two private estates which are High Hill and Eaves Knoll. They were built in 1960 to 1970.
